intro: Brachystephium leucanthemoides, commonly known as the white-flowered brachystephium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
